greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest m in range 2..n-1 such that m^10 == 1 mod n, or 1 if no such number exists.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: for m from 2 to n-1 do
if m &^ 10 mod n = 1 then return m fi
mathematica: a[n_] := Module[{r = 1}, Do[If[PowerMod[m, 10, n] == 1, r = m; Break[]], {m, 2, n-1}]; r]; Array[a, 100] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 10 2015 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = {for (m=2, n-1, if (lift(Mod(m, n)^10) == 1, return (m));); return (1);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 29 2014
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 08 2002
